member.name: T:antlr.TokenCreator
member.summary: A creator of Token object instances.

remarks.para: This class and it's sub-classes exists primarily as an optimization of the reflection-based mechanism(s) previously used exclusively to create instances of Token objects.
Since Lexers in ANTLR use a single Token type, each TokenCreator can create one class of Token objects (that's why it's not called TokenFactory).

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.AnalyticsQuery
member.summary: An AnalyticsQuery is an ordered list of objects.
member.remarks:
After creation, the AnalyticsQuery object is set in an object via the setter property.
When the query is executed on the MDEX Engine, each transforms an input set of records into a resulting stream of aggregated records. Each operates on the record set produced by some previous , or on the records in the Navigation State, or on all the records in the MDEX Engine. Note that each in the AnalyticsQuery must have a unique name.
Users can construct an AnalyticsQuery with either the programmatic interface or a text-based syntax. Much of the text-based syntax is based on a subset of the SQL language. Use the parser method to create an AnalyticsQuery from the String representation of the query. For example, if str is a String that has been initialized to a valid query, then the statement:
AnalyticsQuery analytics = AnalyticsQuery.parseQuery(str);
creates an AnalyticsQuery when the str query is parsed.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.CoalesceList
member.summary: CoalesceList instances represent a list of expressions used to return the the first non-null value in the list. These coalesce expressions are objects of type .
member.remarks: Coalesce expressions provide the ability to evalute records for multiple values and return the first non-null value encountered, in the order specified. The CoalesceList saves the expressions in the form of a list, in the same order as specified in the query.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate
member.summary: Instances of the ExprAggregate class represent aggregate functions over the members of the associated aggregated record.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.IExpr
member.summary: IExpr is the interface for various types of composable Select derived property expressions.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.SUM
member.summary: Sum function.
member.remarks: Computes the sum of the subexpression across all input values.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.AVG
member.summary: Average function.
member.remarks: Computes the average (arithmetic mean) of all input values.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.VARIANCE
member.summary: Variance function.
member.remarks: Computes the variance for a field. The variance is the square of the standard deviation.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.STDDEV
member.summary: Standard Deviation function.
member.remarks: Computes the standard deviation for a field.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.MIN
member.summary: Minimum function.
member.remarks: Computes the minimum value of the subexpression across all input values.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.MAX
member.summary: Maximum function.
member.remarks: Computes the maximum value of the subexpression across all input values.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.COUNT
member.summary: Count function.
member.remarks: Counts the values in a field.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.COUNTDISTINCT
member.summary: Count Distinct function.
member.remarks: Counts the distinct values in a field, with no repetition.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.MEDIAN
member.summary: Median function.
member.remarks: Finds the median value for a field.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.ARB
member.summary: Arbitrary function.
member.remarks: Selects an arbitrary but consistent value from the set of values in a field.

member.summary: Creates a new , which will compute an aggregate function over the evaluation of the subexpression on the members of the aggregated record.
member.param: An aggregate function of type . See the property for a list of the function names.
An object of type that will be the subexpression for this .
member.remarks: nodes may not be nested. That is, neither the specified subexpression nor any of its descendant subexpressions may be instances of ; otherwise, the resulting expression is semantically invalid (note that this will not be caught by the method).

member.remarks:
The format is:
FUNCTION(subexpression)
where FUNCTION is an aggregate function name.
The format for an with a filter is:
FUNCTION(subexpression) WHERE filter
where filter is the filter added by the setting property.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprAggregate.Filter
member.summary: Gets and sets the filter associated with this expression.
member.value: The filter (of type ) associated with this expression.
member.remarks:
For the getter version, only records in the associated aggregate that satisfy the returned filter contribute to the derived value represented by this expression.
For the setter version, adding a filter to this expression causes only records that satisfy the filter to be taken into account by this aggregate.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary
member.summary: An ExprBinary is a type of that represents a binary scalar expression. These expressions provide a full range of mathematical functions, such as addition and subtraction operators.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.PLUS
member.summary: Addition operator.
member.remarks: Adds the right-hand and left-hand sides of the expression.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.MINUS
member.summary: Subtraction operator.
member.remarks: Subtracts the right-hand side of the expression from the left-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.MULTIPLY
member.summary: Multiplication operator.
member.remarks: Multiplies the left-hand side of the expression by the value in the right-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.DIVIDE
member.summary: Division operator.
member.remarks: Divides the left-hand side of the expression by the value in the right-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.LOG
member.summary: Logarithm operator.
member.remarks: Returns the logarithm of the right-hand side, where the value in the left-hand side is the base.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.MOD
member.summary: Modulo (remainder) operator.
member.remarks: Returns the remainder of the division of the left-hand side by the value in the right-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.POWER
member.summary: Exponentiation operator.
member.remarks: Returns the value of the left-hand side raised to the power of the value in the right-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.ROUND
member.summary: Round operator.
member.remarks: Rounds the number in the left-hand side to the number of decimal places specified by the integer in the right-hand side.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.TRUNC
member.summary: Truncation operator.
member.remarks: Truncates the number in the left-hand side to the number of decimal places specified by the integer in the right-hand side.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.#ctor(Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.ExprBinaryOp,Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.IExpr,Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.IExpr)
member.summary: The will compute the specified specified on the specified and parameters.
member.param: A mathematical function (of type ) that specifies the type of operation to be made. See the property for a list of the function names.
An object of type that will be the left-hand side of this binary expression.
An object of type that will be the right-hand side of this binary expression.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.ToWire
member.summary: Returns the wire form of this .
member.remarks: This method is not intended for public use because the wire format is subject to change.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string form of this .
member.remarks:
The format for the DIVIDE, MINUS, MULTIPLY, and PLUS operators is:
"lhs-expression sign rhs-expression"
where sign is / (for DIVIDE), - (for MINUS), * (for MULTIPY), or + (for PLUS).
The format for the other operators is:
"op(lhs-expression, rhs-expression)"
where op is LOG, MOD, POWER, BROUND, or BTRUNC.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.ValidateSyntax
member.summary: Validates the syntax of this .
member.remarks: An is valid if both the right-hand side and left-hand side subexpressions are non-null and valid, and the function is not null.
member.exception: If the syntax requirements are not met.

member.summary: Gets and sets the left-hand side of this binary expression.
member.value: An object of type that is the left-hand side for this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.Rhs
member.summary: Gets and sets the right-hand side of this binary expression.
member.value: An object of type that is the right-hand side for this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprBinary.Function
member.summary: Gets and sets the the mathematical function for this .
member.value: An object of type that is the function for this .
member.remarks: The mathematical functions are: ExprBinary.DIVIDE, ExprBinary.LOG, ExprBinary.MINUS, ExprBinary.MOD, ExprBinary.MULTIPLY, ExprBinary.PLUS, ExprBinary.POWER, ExprBinary.ROUND, and ExprBinary.TRUNC.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.DAY_OF_MONTH

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.DAY_OF_YEAR
member.summary: Day-of-year constant.
member.remarks: Used to designate that a day of the year be the value for the and functions.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.DATE
member.summary: Date constant.
member.remarks: Used to designate the date as a day in the month, as the value for the and functions.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.WEEK
member.summary: Week constant.
member.remarks: Used to designate that a week be the value for the and functions.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.MONTH
member.summary: Month constant.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.QUARTER

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.YEAR
member.summary: Year constant.
member.remarks: Used to designate that a year be the value for the and functions.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.ABS
member.summary: Absolute value function.
member.remarks: Returns the absolute value of a number.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.CEIL
member.summary: Ceiling function.
member.remarks: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to a given numeric expression.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.COS
member.summary: Cosine function.
member.remarks: Returns the cosine, in radians, of an angle.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.EXP
member.summary: Exponential function.
member.remarks: Returns the log exponential (base e) value of a given numeric expression.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.EXTRACT
member.summary: Date Extraction function.
member.remarks: Extracts a portion of a DateTime property value, such as the day of the week or month of the year. The portion to be extracted is specified with an integer in the decPlaces parameter of the constructor.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.FLOOR
member.summary: Floor function.
member.remarks: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to a given numeric expression.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.LAG
member.summary: Lag function.
member.remarks: Returns a value in a row a specified number of rows from a current row. LAG provides access to a row at a given offset prior to the current position. The offset is specified with the decPlaces parameter of the constructor.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.LEAD
member.summary: Lead function.
member.remarks: Returns a value in a row a specified number of rows from a current row. LEAD provides access to a row at a given offset after the current position. The offset is specified with the decPlaces parameter of the constructor.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.LN
member.summary: Natural logarithm function.
member.remarks: Returns the logarithm of its single argument, the base of which is e.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.ROUND
member.summary: Round function.
member.remarks: Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.SIGN
member.summary: Sign function.
member.remarks: Returns the sign of a given numeric expression. SIGN returns -1 (if the expression is less than zero), 0 (if the expression is zero), or 1 (if the expression is greater than zero).

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.SIN
member.summary: Sine function.
member.remarks: Returns the sine, in radians, of an angle.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.SQRT
member.summary: Square root function.
member.remarks: Returns the square root of a given numeric expression.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprFunction.TAN

member.summary: Date Truncation function.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.ExprLookup
member.summary: ExprLookup instances represent an access to a derived property of a record in a foreign table.
member.remarks:
MyTable[{expr1}, {expr2}].field is semantically correct if MyTable is GROUPed by the same number of fields as the number of expressions within brackets "[...]", and field is a derived property defined on MyTable. Brackets with no expression list within represent access to a table that is GROUPed to a single record.
Note that because the implicit tables NavStateRecords and AllBaseRecords are not GROUPED, it is not possible to do a lookup on these tables.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare
member.summary: A FilterCompare is a type of that performs a value comparison.
member.remarks:
After being created, the FilterCompare object is then set in a object with the or methods.
A FilterCompare can also be used to determine if the value of an Endeca property or dimension is null or non-null.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.EQ
member.summary: EQUAL TO operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is equal to the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.NEQ
member.summary: NOT EQUAL TO operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is not equal to the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.LT
member.summary: LESS THAN operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is less than the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.LTE
member.summary: LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is less than or equal to the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.GT
member.summary: GREATER THAN operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is greater than the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.GTE
member.summary: GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the value of fieldName is less than the value of the val parameter.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.IS_NULL
member.summary: NULL operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the fieldName is null. The val parameter is ignored.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: NON-NULL operator.
member.remarks: Determines if the fieldName is null. The val parameter is ignored.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.DVAL
member.summary: DVAL operator.
member.remarks: Used to filter records by a dimension value with an ID specified by the val parameter.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.#ctor(System.String,Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.FilterCompareOp,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new FilterCompare object.
member.param: The name of an Endeca property or dimension. The value of will be compared to the literal value of . Note that this value is ignored for the function.
A comparison function of type . See the property for a list of the comparison function names.

A literal value to be compared to the value of . For the FilterCompare.DVAL function, this value specifies the ID of a dimension value.
Note that this value is ignored for the FilterCompare.IS_NULL and FilterCompare.IS_NOT_NULL functions.
member.remarks:
The FilterCompare compares the value for the Endeca property or dimension to the value specified by using the function specified by .
The filter evaluates to true for a given record if the specified comparison function evaluates to true when applied to the value for from the record (lhs) and the specified (rhs). For example, if is "Price" and the record has a Price of 1.00, and the function is FilterCompare.LT and is 2.00, then the filter would evaluate to true.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.ToWire
member.summary: Returns the wire form of this .
member.remarks: This method is not intended for public use because the wire format is subject to change.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string form of this .
member.remarks:
The format is:
("fieldName" "compare-function" 'compare-value')
Note that compare-value is not returned for the FilterCompare.IS_NULL and FilterCompare.IS_NOT_NULL functions.
For the FilterCompare.DVAL function, the format is:
(DVAL("value")
For example:
("SalesTotal" "FilterCompare.GT" '10000')
is returned if the property name is "SalesTotal" and a GREATER THAN comparison is being made to the value of 10000.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.ValidateSyntax
member.summary: Validates the syntax of this .
member.remarks: A is valid if the function is non-null and the fieldName and val are non-null and non-empty.
member.exception: If the syntax requirements are not met.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.FieldName
member.summary: Gets and sets the fieldName for this .
member.value:
The name of an Endeca property or dimension that is the fieldName setting for this .
The value of this field will either be tested for a null value or will be compared to the val parameter. Note that this value is ignored for the function.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.Function
member.summary: Gets and sets the comparison function for this .
member.value: The comparison function (of type ) for this . An example is FilterCompare.LT for the LESS THAN operator.
member.remarks: The comparison functions are: FilterCompare.EQ, FilterCompare.NEQ, FilterCompare.LT, FilterCompare.LTE, FilterCompare.GT, FilterCompare.GTE, FilterCompare.IS_NULL, FilterCompare.IS_NOT_NULL, and FilterCompare.DVAL.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterCompare.Value
member.summary: Gets and sets the value for this .
member.value: The value to be compared.
member.remarks:
The value will be compared to the value of the fieldName, using the specified comparison function. For the function, value specifies the ID of the dimension value that will be used to filter records.
Note that this value is ignored for the and functions.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterIn
member.summary: A FilterIn is an that checks membership of a given set of values in a table. The membership is checked with a set of lookup expressions in a that is set in the FilterIn.
member.remarks:
This filter:
"[expression1, expression2] IN MyTable"
is semantically correct if MyTable is GROUPED by the same number of fields as the number of expressions within brackets "[...]". In this way, the contents of the brackets uniquely identify a record in MyTable. Brackets with no expression list within represent access to a table that is GROUPed to a single record.
Because the implicit tables NavStateRecords and AllBaseRecords are not GROUPED, it is not possible to do a lookup on these tables.

member.remarks: This method is not intended for public use because the wire format is subject to change.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.FilterIn.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string form of this .
member.remarks:
The format is:
[expression1, expression2...] IN table-name
where each expression is a lookup expression in the .

member.summary: Validates the syntax of this .
member.remarks: A is valid if the table name is non-null and non-empty ahd the is itself valid.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy
member.summary: A defines a single dimension of record grouping for a containing operation.
member.remarks: Basically, a represents an Endeca property or dimension by which records will be grouped. Input records for the containing operation are grouped together by common assignment from the property or dimension. instances are encapsulated in a , which in turn is set in the object.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new .
member.param: The name of the Endeca property or dimension by which the records will be aggregated.
member.remarks: This one-parameter constructor will request aggregation of records into groups based on the Endeca property or dimension named .

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new , which will request aggregation of records into groups based on the Endeca property or dimension named .
member.param: The name of the Endeca property or dimension by which the records will be aggregated.
The level of a dimension hierarchy at which the grouping will be performed.
member.remarks:
This two-parameter constructor will request aggregation of records into groups based on the Endeca property or dimension named . For dimensions, the grouping will depend on the value's ancestor at from the root of the dimension's hierarchy.
Note that a of zero does not indicate grouping at the root of the hierarchy, but rather it denotes that depth will not be taken into account at all, so grouping will be performed based on the values encountered.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy.ToWire
member.summary: Returns the wire form of this .
member.remarks: This method is not intended for public use because the wire format is subject to change.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string form of this .
member.remarks:
The format is:
"grouping-key-name"
if no depth has been set.
The format:
"grouping-key-name:depth"
is used if depth has been specified.
member.example:
The string:
Region:2
is returned if the grouping key is a dimension named Region with a grouping level of 2 (that is, two levels below the root of the dimension hierarchy).

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.GroupBy.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether this has an equivalence to a reference specified by .
member.param: The reference with which to compare.
member.returns: true if this is the same as ; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Note that the the depth settings of the two objects are not compared.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.LookupList
member.summary: LookupList instances represent a list of expressions used to uniquely identify a record in a table (foreign or local). These lookup expressions are objects of type .
member.remarks:
Lookup expressions provide the ability to refer to values in record sets that have been previously computed. Lookups can only refer to record sets that were grouped and the LookupList must match the fields of the lookup record set.
A lookup expression maps a record in the current statements record set to a record in the lookup record set. A LookupList should therefore contain the same number of expressions as the size of the of the table it is used to key into.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.Statement
member.summary: A represents a pass over a set of input records (those of the FROM table) to generate a set of output records.
member.remarks:
Input records and output records may be filtered; output records are populated with derived values, and with values by which the records are GROUPed. The output record set may be sorted and paged.
A has the form:
RETURN {table-name} AS // required: RETURN or DEFINE: see
SELECT // required
{expr1} AS {field1}, // required: at least one assignment.
{expr2} AS {field2},
...
WHERE {filter} // optional
FROM {table-name} // optional
GROUP // optional: or GROUP BY {field}, {field},...
HAVING {filter} // optional
ORDER BY {field},{field}... // optional
PAGE({start}, {end}) // optional
NavStateRecords and AllBaseRecords are reserved table names. NavStateRecords is the default if the FROM clause is omitted.

member.remarks: An empty will act as a simple pass-through of records.

member.summary: Gets and sets whether the is a Return or Define .
member.value: true if the current is a Return statement (indicates that the application wants to see its result records), or false if it is a Define statement (indicates that it is only used as an intermediate calculation).
member.remarks: Return means that the results should be returned to the client, while Define means that it will only be used to compute other results.

member.summary: Gets and sets the list of expressions for this .

member.remarks: Each associates a derived value with each result aggregated record produced by this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.Statement.WhereFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the WHERE clause for this .
member.value: An containing the WHERE clause for this .
member.remarks: The WHERE clause acts as a filter on input records that will be grouped into result aggregates. In other words, it specifies a pre-filter for this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.Statement.HavingFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the HAVING clause for this .
member.value: An containing the HAVING clause for this .
member.remarks: A HAVING clause acts as a filter on output aggregated records. In other words, it specifies a post-filter for this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.Statement.GroupByList
member.summary: Gets and sets the for this .
member.value: The for this .
member.remarks:
The determines the way that input records are grouped into result aggregated records.
Basically, each in the specified represents a grouping property or dimension, and input records are assigned to a resulting aggregate based on their values for these properties and dimensions. Note that if an empty is attached to a , it indicates that the input records will be GROUPed to a single record.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Analytics.Statement.OrderByList
member.summary: Gets and sets the for this .
member.value: The for this . Note that the cannot be empty.
member.remarks: The list of specifications for the determines the order in which result aggregated records will be returned, and determines the ranks of result aggregated records used by paging controls associated with specifications.

member.summary: Tests whether this is paged.
member.value: true if this is paged, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
A is paged if the application only wants a subset of the records that the computes.
By default, the paged setting is false. Calling the method sets paged to true.

member.name: T:antlr.ASTNodeCreator
member.summary: A creator of AST node instances.

remarks.para: This class and it's sub-classes exists primarily as an optimization of the reflection-based mechanism(s) previously used exclusively to create instances of AST node objects.

Parsers and TreeParsers already use the ASTFactory class in ANTLR whenever they need to create an AST node objeect. What this class does is to support performant extensibility of the basic ASTFactory. The ASTFactory can now be extnded as run-time to support more new AST node types without using needing to use reflection.

member.name: T:antlr.InputBuffer
member.summary: Represents a stream of characters fed to the lexer from that can be rewound via mark()/rewind() methods.

remarks.para: A dynamic array is used to buffer up all the input characters. Normally, "k" characters are stored in the buffer. More characters may be stored during guess mode (testing syntactic predicate), or when LT(i>k) is referenced. Consumption of characters is deferred. In other words, reading the next character is not done by conume(), but deferred until needed by LA or LT.

member.name: T:antlr.TokenStreamRewriteEngine
member.summary: This token stream tracks the *entire* token stream coming from a lexer, but does not pass on the whitespace (or whatever else you want to discard) to the parser.

remarks.para: This class can then be asked for the ith token in the input stream. Useful for dumping out the input stream exactly after doing some augmentation or other manipulations. Tokens are index from 0..n-1

You can insert stuff, replace, and delete chunks. Note that the operations are done lazily--only if you convert the buffer to a string. This is very efficient because you are not moving data around all the time. As the buffer of tokens is converted to strings, the toString() method(s) check to see if there is an operation at the current index. If so, the operation is done and then normal string rendering continues on the buffer. This is like having multiple Turing machine instruction streams (programs) operating on a single input tape. :)

Since the operations are done lazily at toString-time, operations do not screw up the token index values. That is, an insert operation at token index i does not change the index values for tokens i+1..n-1.

Because operations never actually alter the buffer, you may always get the original token stream back without undoing anything. Since the instructions are queued up, you can easily simulate transactions and roll back any changes if there is an error just by removing instructions. For example,

You can also have multiple "instruction streams" and get multiple rewrites from a single pass over the input. Just name the instruction streams and use that name again when printing the buffer. This could be useful for generating a C file and also its header file--all from the same buffer.
If you don't use named rewrite streams, a "default" stream is used.
Terence Parr, parrt@cs.usfca.edu University of San Francisco February 2004

member.name: T:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser
member.summary: Specifies the behaviour required (i.e. parser modifications) specifically to support parse tree debugging and derivation.

remarks.para: Override the standard matching and rule entry/exit routines to build parse trees. This class is useful for 2.7.3 where you can specify a superclass like
class TinyCParser extends Parser(ParseTreeDebugParser);

member.name: F:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.currentParseTreeRoot
member.summary: Each new rule invocation must have it's own subtree. Tokens are added to the current root so we must have a stack of subtree roots.

member.name: F:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.mostRecentParseTreeRoot
member.summary: Track most recently created parse subtree so that when parsing is finished, we can get to the root.

member.name: F:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.numberOfDerivationSteps
member.summary: For every rule replacement with a production, we bump up count.

member.name: M:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.addCurrentTokenToParseTree
member.summary: Adds LT(1) to the current parse subtree.

remarks.para: Note that the match() routines add the node before checking for correct match. This means that, upon mismatched token, there will a token node in the tree corresponding to where that token was expected. For no viable alternative errors, no node will be in the tree as nothing was matched() (the lookahead failed to predict an alternative).

member.name: M:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.traceIn(System.String)
member.summary: Create a rule node, add to current tree, and make it current root

member.name: M:antlr.debug.ParseTreeDebugParser.traceOut(System.String)
member.summary: Pop current root; back to adding to old root

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.IPropertyContainer
member.summary: Interface for an object that has properties and has those properties exposed as a . The purpose for this interface is to allow common code to be used in the extraction of any object that supports this interface, for example building tag libraries around property containers.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.AggrERec.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of the aggregated record.
member.value: The ID of the aggregated record.

member.summary: Gets the specification of the aggregated record.
member.value: The specification of the aggregated record.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.AggrERec.Properties
member.summary: Gets the properties of the aggregated record.
member.value: The properties of this aggregated record.
member.remarks: If the aggregated record does not have any properties, an empty will still be returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.AggrERec.Representative
member.summary: Gets the representative record of the aggregated record.
member.value: Representative record for aggregated record or null if the records of the aggregated record were not retrieved during the query.
member.remarks: If the number of records per aggregated record is set to zero in the query this method will return null.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.AggrERec.ERecs
member.summary: Gets the objects of this aggregated record.
member.value: objects of the aggregated record.
member.remarks: This list may contain all records of the aggregated record, a subset or none, based on the nature of the query that retrieved the aggregated record. In the case there are none an empty will still be returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.AggrERec.TotalNumERecs
member.summary: Gets the total number of objects aggregated in this aggregated Endeca record.
member.value: The total number of objects that compose this aggregated Endeca record.
member.remarks: Based on the query, it is possible that a subset of the entire set of Endeca records ( objects) of the aggregated record are returned or none at all. This method returns the total number that exist.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.AuthHttpENEConnection
member.summary: An extention of that provides connections to Endeca MDEX Engines that require authentication. Use instances of this class to connect to an Endeca MDEX Engine via the Endeca Access Control System.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.HttpENEConnection
member.summary: Provides a connection to an Endeca MDEX Engine over HTTP. Also provides a mechanism for issuing queries to the MDEX Engine.
member.remarks:
The is currently the only implementation of the interface.
This connection is a repository for hostname and port configuration parameters for HTTP connections to an Endeca MDEX Engine. The connection does not open a persistant connection to the MDEX Engine. The instantiation of this connection does not initiate an HTTP socket connection. Instead each issuance of the method opens a HTTP socket connection(s), makes the requests, and closes the connection(s).

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.IENEConnection
member.summary:
A connection with an Endeca MDEX Engine. With a connection, queries can be issued to the MDEX Engine and are returned.
The only current type of connection offered is the .

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.IENEConnection.Query(Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery)
member.summary: Makes a query against an Endeca MDEX Engine.
member.param: Query to make.
member.remarks: The query results.
member.exception: If an Endeca MDEX Engine query fails.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.HttpENEConnection.#ctor
member.summary: Default empty constructor.
member.remarks: Hostname and port need to be set before is called, else a will be thrown.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.HttpENEConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for connection to an Endeca MDEX Engine over HTTP.
member.param: Hostname or IP address of the MDEX Engine. Example: 127.0.0.1 or engine.endeca.com.
Hostname or IP address of the MDEX Engine. Port of the MDEX Engine. Example: 5001.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.HttpENEConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for connection to an Endeca MDEX Engine over HTTP.
member.param: Hostname or IP address of the MDEX Engine. Example: 127.0.0.1 or engine.endeca.com.
Port of the MDEX Engine. Example: 5001.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.HttpENEConnection.Query(Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery)
member.summary: Issues a query against the MDEX Engine.
member.param: The query object containing the navigation, record etc. type requests to the MDEX Engine
member.returns: Returns a object which contains the resultant objects returned by the MDEX Engine in response to the query .
member.exception:
If there is a problem making the query.
Possible subclasses of that could be thrown are , , , , , and so on.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension
member.summary: Core component of a navigation state query encapsulating all information known about a dimension at the navigation state.
member.remarks:
A dimension is a collection of related dimension values ( objects), organized into a tree. The top-most dimension value in a dimension tree is known as the dimension root. A dimension root always has the same name as its dimension.
Each dimension can belong to only a single dimension group ( object). If a dimension is not assigned to an explicit dimension group, it is placed in an implicit dimension group of its own. These implicit groups have no name and an ID of zero.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.IsInNavState
member.summary: isInNavState
member.value: boolean

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.IsInEdgeGroups
member.summary: isInEdgeGroups
member.value: boolean

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.IsGroupOpen
member.summary: isGroupOpen
member.value: boolean

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.IsImplicit
member.summary: Determines if the dimension is fully implicit.
member.remarks: A dimension is considered fully implicit if the dimension has no non-implicit refinements and has no descriptors. That is, the dimension no longer has any refinments that would narrow the size of the results set and has not had any selections made to it.
member.returns: true if the dimension is fully implicit, and false if the dimenension contains any valid refinements or a descriptor.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.DimGroupName
member.summary: Gets the name of the dimension group to which this dimension belongs.
member.value: Name of the dimension group ( object) to which this dimension belongs or null if it does not belong to a group.
member.remarks: If the dimension does not belong to a dimension group, the method will return null.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.DimGroupId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the dimension group to which this dimension belongs.
member.value: ID of the dimension group to which this dimension belongs or 0 if it does not belong to a group.
member.remarks: If the dimension does not belong to a dimension group, the method will return 0.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of the dimension.
member.value: ID of the dimension.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the dimension.
member.value: The name of the dimension.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Root
member.summary: Gets the root dimension value of this dimension.
member.value: The root dimension value ( object) of this dimension.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Descriptor
member.summary: Gets the descriptor for this dimension.
member.value: Descriptor ( object) for this dimension, or null if there is none.
member.remarks: If there is no descriptor in this dimension, null is returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.RefinementParent
member.summary: Gets the refinements' parent value in this dimension.
member.value: Refinements' parent value ( object) in this dimension. Returns null if there are no more refinement possiblities in this dimension.
member.remarks: The parent value is the parent of the refinement options available with respect to the current navigation state in this dimension hierarchy. Returns null if there are no more refinements possible in this dimension.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.InternalId
member.summary: getId
member.value: long

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Ancestors
member.summary: Gets the ancestors pertinent to this dimension.
member.value: Ancestors of the descriptor of this dimension. If there is no descriptor or the descriptor has no ancestors, the returned will be empty.
member.remarks: Will still return an empty if there are no ancestors. Ancestors will only appear if there is a descriptor for this dimension and if the descriptor has ancestors in the hierarchy of the dimension. Does not include the dimension root value. Ancestors are ordered from parent to child.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Intermediates
member.summary: Gets the intermediate non-navigable refinements that have been selected and do not affect the query terms.
member.value: List of intermediates. If there are no intermediates an empty will be returned.
member.remarks: If there are no intermediates an empty will be returned. Intermediates are ordered from parent to child.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.ImplicitLocations
member.summary: Gets the implicit dimension locations contained in this dimension.
member.value: List of intermediates. If there are no intermediates an empty will be returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.Refinements
member.summary: Gets the refinements available and retrieved in this dimension.
member.value: Refinements available in this dimension. Returns an empty if no refinements are available.
member.remarks:
Returns an empty when there are no refinements available. It is possible that while the refinements may return a empty set, refinements are still possible if not all the refinements were retrieved from the MDEX Engine in the original query. Refinements are ordered by the higher ranking to lower ranking where the rankings are determined by the settings in the MDEX Engine and the data.
Each member of this refinement list can be added to the Descriptors and will yield at least one results.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Dimension.CompletePath
member.summary: Returns the complete path of the dimension values consolidating ancestors, descriptor, and implicits in this order.
member.remarks:
Implicits are the the dimension values ( objects) that are implicitly shared by all of the results in the remaining result set.
In the case where refinements are present in this dimension, the complete path will offer the complete path of dimension values, from the dimension root, ancestors, descriptor, implicit dimension values, and intermediates to the refinement parent.
In the case where there are multiple assignment of dimension values to a record in the result set, and there are no refinements remaining in this dimension, the complete path will offer one of the complete branches of implicit dimension values.
At the minimal case, this list would return the root dimension value of the dimension.
member.value: Complete list (as a object) of dimension values from the dimension.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimensionList

member.summary: Gets the with the ID from this list.
member.param: ID of the dimension to get.
member.returns: Dimension with the ID or null if the dimension is not found.
member.remarks: If the dimension is not found in this list, null is returned. Note that when dealing with multi-select dimensions, it is possible for the list to have multiple objects for the same dimension. member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimGroup
member.summary: Class encapsulating a group of dimensions.
member.remarks:
Dimension groups provide a way to impose relationships on dimensions ( objects). By creating a dimension group, dimensions can be organized for presentation purposes. Each explicit dimension group must be given a name; a unique ID is generated when the data is indexed.
If a dimension is not assigned to an explicit dimension group, it is placed in an implicit dimension group of its own. These implicit groups have no name and an ID of zero.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.DimGroup.IsExplicit
member.summary: Determines if the dimension group is an explicit or implicit dimension group.
member.returns: true if the dimension group is an explicit dimension; false if it is an implicit dimension group.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimLocation
member.summary: DimLocation represents a specific location in a dimension.
member.remarks:
The dimension location comprises one dimension value ( object) and a that contains all of the dimension locations ancestors (also objects) up to, but not including, the dimension root.
DimLocation objects are returned as part of an Endeca record, via an object in the data structure. The dimension locations designate the records location within the dimension hierarchy.
Note that when returned in an object, the dimension locations are all from the same dimension. However, when returned in a object, the dimension locations can be from different dimensions (which is typically the result of a compound dimension search).

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.DimLocation.DimValue
member.summary: Gets the dimension value of this dimension location.
member.value: Dimension value ( object) of this .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.DimLocation.Ancestors
member.summary: Gets the ancestors of the dimension location.
member.value: A object containing the ancestors of this dimension location.
member.remarks: Ancestors are ordered from parent to child (the list does not include the dimension root).

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimLocationList
member.summary: List containing objects exposed as an .
member.remarks: Unlike objects, the objects in a DimLocationList can be from different dimensions. Therefore, the contents of a DimLocationList often contain values from different dimensions. As such, the intended use of this class is to return results from a compound dimension search. Each individual compound dimension search result is a DimLocationList and typically contains dimension values from multiple dimensions.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimVal
member.summary: A dimension value is the lowest-level building block that compose dimensions, navigations, and classifications of records.
member.remarks:
A is a collection of related dimension values, organized into a tree. The top-most dimension value in a dimension tree is known as the dimension root. A dimension root always has the same name as its dimension. Every dimension value has a unique ID.
Dimension values are tags that classify the records in a data set. Tagging a record with a dimension value identifies the record as a valid result when that dimension value is selected in a navigation query.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.DimVal.IsLeaf
member.summary: Indicates if this dimension value is a leaf.
member.returns: true if this dimension value is a leaf (has no child dimension values). false if it is not (has child dimension values).

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.DimVal.IsNavigable
member.summary: Indicates if this dimension value is navigable.
member.returns: true if this dimension value is navigable, false if it is not.
member.remarks: If the dimension value is navigable, it can be placed in the navigation state or classify a record.

member.returns: true if this dimension value is "multi-select and" capable, false if it is not.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.DimValIdList
member.summary: List of dimension value IDs.
member.remarks:
Every dimension value ( object) has a unique ID. A DimValIdList object contains a list of dimension value IDs. Typically, the developer does not create and populate the DimValIdList object, but instead it is returned by get properties such as . Note that while DimValIdList objects are lists of dimension value IDs, objects are lists of the actual dimension values.
DimValIdList objects are primarily used to generate MDEX Engine queries. For example, dimension value IDs are used before executing a basic navigation query, as the input argument to the property setter. There will be a one-to-one mapping between the IDs in the DimValIdList argument and the dimension values ( objects) that are returned by the query.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery
member.summary: An object used for expressing queries to an Endeca MDEX Engine.
member.remarks:
An ENEQuery object is used with a Query method (of or ) to query an MDEX Engine, which then returns an object.
The ENEQuery object can contain one of each of the following: a record query, a navigation query, an aggregated record query, a dimension search query, and/or a navigation search.
While there are many query options, only a few critical setters are necessary to make basic queries:
Basic navigation queries require a setting .
Basic record queries require a setting .
Basic aggregated record queries require setting , , and .
Basic dimension search queries require a setting .

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.NAV_SORT_ASCENDING
member.summary: Sort the navigation query's matching records in ascending order.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.NAV_SORT_DESCENDING
member.summary: Sort the navigation query's matching records in descending order.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.ALL_ERECS_PER_AGGR
member.summary: All records that compose a aggregated record will be returned.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.ONE_EREC_PER_AGGR
member.summary: One of the records that compose a aggregated record will be returned.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.ZERO_ERECS_PER_AGGR
member.summary: None of the records that compose a aggregated record will be returned.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.DIM_SEARCH_ALL_DIM_VALUES
member.summary: All matches from dimension search will be returned from each dimension.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.KEY_PROPS_NONE
member.summary: Request that no key properties will be returned.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.MAX_BULK_ERECS_AVAILABLE
member.summary: All the records that are associated with the current navigation state should be returned through the bulk record iterator.

member.param: The int specifying the sort order. The sort order can either be or . Defaults to ascending and is only applied if the a sort key is present in query as well.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.GetNavActiveSortKeys
member.summary: Get the list of sort keys with which the navigation query's records will be sorted.
member.value: The list of keys that will be used to sort the records. The order of the keys is significant. The first key is the primary sort criterion, the second key is the secondary sort criterion, etc.
member.returns: ERecSortKeyList - The sort keys used in this query. The records are sorted by the first key in the list, resolving ties with the second key. Ties on the second key are resolved using the third key, and so forth.

member.summary: Set the list of sort keys with which the navigation query's records will be sorted.
member.param: The used to sort the navigation query's records.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQuery.NavAnalytics
member.summary: Gets and sets the analytics computation for the navigation query so that an analytics computation is performed on the navigation records.
member.value: Analytics computation of the navigation query or null if none specified.
member.remarks:
The syntax for this currently is a '|' delimited sequence of the form:
<function>|<property key>|<rollup key>|<property key>|<model name>|<model name>|...
Function can be one of COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX, CAVG. Specifying an analytics computation causes results to appear in the Navigation's supplements.
This functionality and syntax is not supported in InFront nor enterprise search deployments and may not be supported in further releases.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo
member.summary: An object that generates and stores logging-specific query information.
member.remarks: ENEQueryInfo is used to create and store logging-specific query information, such as a session ID and query ID. The resulting ENEQueryInfo object can then passed to the Endeca MDEX Engine in an object by using the setting property. The information in the ENEQueryInfo object is then entered into the Dgraph log by the MDEX Engine.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Takes in and and sets the IDs as logging parameters for the sid and rid keys respectively.
member.param: Session ID to pass on as logging information with the sid key.
Query ID to pass on as logging information with the rid key.
member.remarks: Future versions of the MDEX Engine API may not support this constructor. Instead, this functionailty is preserved by calling the basic constructor for followed by with the IDs and their respective keys.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Takes in and sets it as the value for the sid key. The constructor automatically generates the query ID and sets it as the value for the rid key.
member.param: Session ID to pass on as logging information with the sid key.
member.remarks: Future versions of the MDEX Engine API may not support this constructor. Instead, this functionailty is preserved by calling the basic constructor for followed by with the IDs and their respective keys.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Basic constructor for the .
member.remarks: Generates two key/value pairs automatically: the session ID (the sid key) and the query ID (the rid key). This functionality, however, is deprecated and instead developers should generate their own IDs and use the method to set them in the object.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a key/value pair to the object.
member.param: The key for the key/value pair to be added to the object.
The value for the .
member.remarks:
An application may call this method as many times as needed, as each call adds to the key/value pairs being stored in the object. This method will discard keys or values that are NULL or empty strings.
All the key/value pairs will be logged in the Dgraph log when the object is passed to the MDEX Engine with the the setting property.
Note that the current implementation of the basic constructor automatically generates two keys (sid and rid) and their values. This current behavior is deprecated. Therefore, developers should instead generate their own session and query IDs and use this method to override the values of the sid and rid keys.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.SessionIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the value of the Session ID key or sets it to a specified String.
member.value: Session ID (the sid key value) of the query.
member.remarks: This set property may not be supported in future versions of the MDEX Engine API. Use the method instead.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryInfo.QueryIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the value of the Query ID key or sets it to a specified String.
member.value: Query ID of the query.
member.remarks: This method may not be supported in future versions of the MDEX Engine API. Instead, one should use the method instead.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryToolkit
member.summary: ENEQueryToolkit provides static methods for managing the value of the primary URL query parameter in a navigation query. This parameter specifies the list of refinement dimensions that were used to generate the current query results. Managing the parameter's value allows you to maintain application state.
member.remarks: With ENEQueryToolkit, you can update the list of refinement dimensions to reflect the user's latest refinement selection. That selection may require the addition of a new refinement dimension, the removal of a dimension, or the substitution of one dimension ID for another (as in the case where the user selects a refinement from a nested dimension hierarchy).

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryToolkit.SelectRefinement(Endeca.Navigation.Navigation,Endeca.Navigation.DimVal)
member.summary: Method to generate the navigation descriptors of the for a selected refinement. Generates the navigation descriptors of the for a selected refinement. * descriptors that are ancestors of the refinements are removed.
member.param: The current object.
The refinement dimension value (a object) that will be used to reduce the current record set.
member.returns: A object containing the IDs of the new navigation query descriptors after the addition of the specified refinement value to the existing set of navigation descriptors in the object specified by the parameter.
member.remarks: This method adds a refinement value to the set of navigation descriptors already existing in a object and generates a new set of navigation values for the . In general, new refinements are placed at the end of the descriptor list. Existing descriptors that are ancestors of the refinements are removed.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryToolkit.SelectAncestor(Endeca.Navigation.Navigation,Endeca.Navigation.DimVal,Endeca.Navigation.DimVal)
member.summary: Generates the navigation descriptors of the for a selected ancestor.
member.param: The current object.
The ancestor (a object) which will be used to generate new navigation values.
The descriptor (a object) which will be replaced with its ancestor.
member.returns: A object containing the IDs of the new navigation query descriptors after the current navigation descriptor is replaced with its ancestor.
member.remarks: This method replaces the specified navigation descriptor (the parameter) with the ancestor dimension value (the parameter), and generates a new set of navigation values for the . The order of the descriptors remains the same as the order in the current object. However, the specified ancestor is substituted for the specified descriptor.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryToolkit.RemoveDescriptor(Endeca.Navigation.Navigation,Endeca.Navigation.DimVal)
member.summary: Generates the navigation descriptors of the after removing a descriptor.
member.param: The current object.
The descriptor (a object) which will be removed.
member.returns: A object containing the IDs of the new navigation query descriptors after the removal of the descriptor (specified by the parameter).
member.remarks: Removes the specified navigation descriptor (the parameter) from the set of descriptors in the object and generates a new set of navigation values for the . The order of the descriptors in the new navigation query remains the same as the order in the current object (specified by the parameter), with the descriptor removed. Ancestors of the descriptor do not remain after the descriptor has been removed.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ENEQueryToolkit.IsImplicitRefinement(Endeca.Navigation.Dimension,Endeca.Navigation.DimVal)
member.summary: Determines if a dimension value refinement is an implicit refinement within the context of a given dimension.
member.param: The dimension (a object) in which the given refinement should be checked.
The refinement (a object) to check for contraction.
member.returns: true if is an implicit refinement within the dimension , or false otherwise.
member.remarks: An implicit refinement is one that is assigned to all records visible in the current navigation state. In other words, an implicit refinement is one whose selection will not actually narrow the current set of result records.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ERecSearch
member.summary: Class representing a search on a navigation record set.
member.remarks:
A record search is composed of three elements:
search key The name of an Endeca property or dimension (if enabled for record search) or an Endeca search interface. The search key indicates which field of the records to search the terms against.
terms The strings that are being searched, such as raspberry flavor (which may be a quoted phrase).
options The search options, such as the search mode (e.g., mode matchany) and relevance ranking options. This element is optional and can therefore be null.
Note that ERecSearch objects are encapsulated in objects when sent to or returned from the MDEX Engine.

The terms of the search.
member.remarks: The search options are set to null.

member.summary: Constructor specifying the key, terms, and options of the search.
member.param: The key (an Endeca property, dimension, or search interface) of the records with which to search.
The terms of the search.
Sequence of key/value pairs delimited by the '+' character.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ERecSearchList
member.summary: Class that encapsulates a collection of objects, each of which represents a record search.
member.remarks:
ERecSearchList objects are returned from the MDEX Engine by the getter property. The setter version of will set an ERecSearchList list of record searches to perform on the records of a navigation query. Note that the class inherits the property from .
If required by an application, an ERecSearchList object can be created with the default constructor and the list can then be populated with objects by using the method.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport
member.summary: ESearchReport objects contain detailed information about record searches.
member.remarks:
Use to obtain an of ESearchReport objects.
A single ESearchReport object contains information about a single search key. If a query is submitted to the Endeca MDEX Engine with multiple keys, will return an that contains an ESearchReport for each search term that was submitted.
For example, in this query:
N=0&Ntk=Name|Flavors&Ntt=merlot|fuity
the resulting IDictionary will have two entries: one for the Name search key and one for the Flavors search key.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_ALL
member.summary: Match all user search terms (i.e., perform a conjunctive search). This is the default mode.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_ANY
member.summary: Match at least one user search term.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_PARTIAL
member.summary: Match some user search terms.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_PARTIAL_MAX
member.summary: Match a maximal subset of user search terms.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_BOOLEAN
member.summary: Match using a Boolean query.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_ALL_ANY
member.summary: Match all user search terms if possible, otherwise match at least one.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_ALL_PARTIAL
member.summary: Match all user search terms if possible, otherwise match some.

member.name: F:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MODE_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The mode is unknown.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.isValid
member.summary: Determines if the search was a valid search.
member.value: true if the search was a valid search, false otherwise
member.remarks: If false is returned, check the value of for a description of the error.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.Key
member.summary: Gets the name of the Endeca Dimension or Property key used in the search.
member.value: The name of the search key, or null if no key has been specified.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the Ntk parameter of a .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.Terms
member.summary: Gets the terms specified in the search.
member.value: The search terms, or null if none is returned.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the Ntt parameter of a .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.SearchMode
member.summary: Gets the requested search mode used in the search.
member.value: The search mode that was requested when the search was performed. Defaults to .
member.remarks: Corresponds to the Ntx parameter of a .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.MatchedMode
member.summary: Returns the matched search mode that was selected by the MDEX Engine.
member.value: The match mode selected by the MDEX Engine.

remarks.para: MatchedMode is different from in that MatchedMode returns the match mode that was actually selected by the MDEX Engine, as opposed to the match mode that was requested in the query.
For example, assume that this query was issued to the MDEX Engine:

The query is searching for the terms merlot and blackberry and is requesting the match mode of . This search mode will first attempt to perform a search that matches all of the terms; failing that, it will then perform a search that matches any of the terms. Assuming there are no occurrences of blackberry, the resulting match mode will be .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.NumMatchingResults
member.summary: Returns the number of records that matched the search.
member.value: The number of records that matched the search.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the property.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.WordInterps
member.summary: Returns the word interpretations for the record search.
member.value: A representing the set of work interpretations.
member.remarks:
A word interpretation is the treatment of one or more query terms as some other terms during search processing. For example, assume the index contains the following thesaurus entry:
cab > cabernet
If a search is performed for the term cab and there is a match for cabernet, a single word interpretation will be returned with the key cab and a value of cabernet.
In the Automatic Phrasing feature, for each contiguous subsequence of query terms that was treated as a quoted phrase during search processing, a word interpretation will be returned with the original query terms as the key and the query terms in double quotes as the value.
Note that the MDEX Engine's --wordinterp flag must be used to obtain any results from .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.AutoSuggestions
member.summary: Returns the list of automatic spelling corrections and/or alternative phrasing suggestions made by the Endeca MDEX Engine.
member.value: A list of objects, each of which contains a single spelling or phrased suggestion. If there are no suggestions, the list will be empty.
member.remarks:
Alternative phrasing suggestions are used by the MDEX Engine as the query to compute the set of matching documents returned instead of the user's original search query. Alternative phrasing suggestions can be returned under one of the following scenarios:
The MDEX Engine's Automatic Spelling Correction feature is enabled with the Dgraph --spl command line flag.
Alternative phrasing suggestions are requested using the setter property AND the setter property is used to request that the MDEX Engine rewrite the query using one of the alternatives it has computed.
Both of the previous two conditions are met. In this case, the alternative phrasing suggestions returned will incorporate both Spelling Correction and Automatic Phrasing.
An example of having both Spelling Correction and Automatic Phrasing is if a user's query of:
QUERY[New Yorkk restaurants]
is rewritten to an alternative phrasing suggestion of:
QUERY["New York" restaurants]
Here the term "Yorkk" was spell-corrected to "York" and the resulting terms "New" and "York" were suggested to be phrased by the Endeca MDEX Engine as "New York". Only those suggestions that, when issued as queries, would return one or more records (before any navigation filters are applied) will be returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.DYMSuggestions
member.summary: Returns the list of "Did You Mean" suggestions made by the MDEX Engine
member.value: A list of objects. If there are no suggestions, the list will be empty.
member.remarks:
"Did You Mean" suggestions can be returned under the following scenarios:
The MDEX Engine's DYM feature is enabled with the Dgraph --dym command line flag.
Alternative phrasing suggestions are requested using the setter property.
Both of the previous two conditions are met. In this case, the DYM suggestions returned will incorporate both Spelling Correction and Automatic Phrasing.
An example of having both Spelling Correction and Automatic Phrasing is if a user's query of:
QUERY[New Yorkk restaurants]
is rewritten to an alternative phrasing suggestion of:
QUERY["New York" restaurants]
Here the term "Yorkk" was spell-corrected to "York" and the resulting terms "New" and "York" were suggested to be phrased by the Endeca MDEX Engine as "New York". Only those suggestions that, when issued as queries, would return one or more records (before any navigation filters are applied) will be returned.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns the MDEX Engine's error message if the search was not valid.
member.value: A string representing the error message, or null if there is no error.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.NumMatchedTerms
member.summary: Returns the number of search terms that were sucessfully matched when the search was performed.
member.value: The number of terms that matched.
member.remarks: Note that the number of matched terms may be different than the number of terms returned from if the search mode was .

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.ESearchReport.TruncatedTerms
member.summary: Returns a set of search terms after truncation.
member.value: A string representing the truncated search terms, or null if no truncation was performed.
member.remarks: If the number of search terms is too large, the MDEX Engine will truncate the query for performance reasons. TruncatedTerms returns the new set of search terms after the MDEX Engine has peformed the truncation. If no truncation was performed, returns null.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation
member.summary: Top-level object returned from an Endeca MDEX Engine. The Navigation object serves as a container for several components (such as navigation descriptors, record set, etc.) that together compose a navigation.
member.remarks:
A Navigation object is defined by the set of dimension values that were used to query the MDEX Engine to obtain the Navigation object. Those values are in the context of a Navigation object defined as descriptors, the values that describe the navigation query.
In addition, several other objects compose to make a dimension. The records which are the records that meet the query descriptor criteria. The aggregated records which are the same records but rolled up by a certain criteria. The various keys which describe options and operations available on the records. The refinements which are the navigational options that are available to refine the query.
The refinements and the descriptors are broken up by their individual dimensions. There is a third set of dimensions called the integrated dimensions which are the union of the refinement and descriptor dimensions. Lastly all three sets of dimensions are available consolidated by their dimensions groups via the , , and properties.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.DescriptorDimensions
member.summary: Gets the dimensions for the descriptors for this navigation.
member.value: The dimensions of the descriptors of this navigation query.
member.remarks: The descriptors are the set of dimension values that formulate the query that limit the record results of this navigation query. If there are no descriptors, an empty dimension list will be returned. Unlike all other dimension collections presented by the navigation, this collection is NOT in dimension order. Instead this collection IS presented in descriptor order specified by the navigation descriptors of the query, which in turn is most likely generated from which places the descriptors in selection order, that is the order with which the user made their selections.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.DescriptorDimGroups
member.summary: Gets the dimension groups of the dimensions for the descriptors for this navigation.
member.value: The dimension groups of the dimensions of the descriptors.
member.remarks: Similar to except that the dimensions are grouped by their dimension groups. Returns an empty if there are no descriptors. Unlike the descriptor dimensions, these dim groups are presented in MDEX Engine determined dimension order as opposed to the query specified descriptor order.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.RefinementDimensions
member.summary: Gets the dimensions of that still have refinements available with respect to this query.
member.value: The dimension groups of the dimensions that still have refinements available.
member.remarks: The dimensions contained by the list each have refinement options available that refine the record set do at least one record. Returns an empty if there are no more refinements available for this navigation query. The dimensions are in MDEX Engine determined dimension order.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.RefinementDimGroups
member.summary: Gets the dimension groups of the dimensions that still have refinements available with respect to this navigation query.
member.value: The dimension groups of the dimensions that still have refinements available.
member.remarks: This list is analgous to except that they are grouped by their dimension groups. Returns an empty if there are no more refinements available. The dimension groups are in MDEX Engine determined order where the group with the highest ranking dimension is persented first and so on.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.IntegratedDimensions
member.summary: Gets the dimensions integrated from the refinement dimensions and the descriptor dimensions.
member.value: The union of the descriptor and refinement dimensions.
member.remarks: Integrated dimensions are the dimensions that either have descriptors or still have refinement values relative to the navigation query. Returns an empty set if there are neither refinement nor descriptor dimensions. The integrated dimensions are in dimension order specified by the MDEX Engine.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.IntegratedDimGroups
member.summary: Gets the dimension groups of the dimensions integrated from the refinement and descriptor dimensions.
member.value: The descriptor groups of the dimensions unioned from the descriptor and refinement dimensions.
member.remarks: This is analgous to except that the dimensions are consolidated by . Returns an empty set if there are neither refinement nor descriptor dimensions. The dimension groups are in dimension group order determined by the MDEX Engine where the dimension group with the highest ranking dimension is placed first and so on.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.CompleteDimensions
member.summary: Gets the complete dimensions integrated from the refinement dimensions, the descriptor dimensions, and those that are completely implicit.
member.remarks: Complete dimensions are the dimensions that either have descriptors, still have refinement values relative to the navigation query, or only contain implicits. The integrated dimensions are in dimension order specified by the MDEX Engine.
member.value: A that is the union of the descriptor, refinement, and implicit dimensions.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.Navigation.CompleteDimGroups
member.summary: Gets the dimension groups of the complete dimensions integrated from the refinement dimensions, the descriptor dimensions, and those that are completely implicit.
member.remarks: This is analgous to except that the dimensions are consolidated by . That is, complete dimensions are the dimensions that either have descriptors, still have refinement values relative to the navigation query, or only contain implicits. The integrated dimensions are in dimension order specified by the MDEX Engine.
member.value: The dimension groups (a ) of the dimensions unioned from the descriptor, refinement, and implicit dimensions.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.RangeFilter
member.summary: Class representing a range filter on a navigation record set.
member.remarks: A filter is composed of a record property name and a set of conditions that have to be true in order for a record to pass through the filter.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.RangeFilter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor creating a filter.
member.param: Range filter statement.
member.remarks:
A filter consists of a numeric property ( float or int ), and a filter statement that consists of operators LT, LTEQ, GT, GTEQ, or BTWN followed by one or two constants. BTWN is treated as a bounded range, as it is treated inclusive. Examples:
"Price|LT 10.88" "create_date|BTWN 20020131 20020214" "modified|GTEQ 2002"
Range filter statement format:
'<property name>|<filter statement>'
<filter statement> = '[<unbounded range>|<bounded range>]' <unbounded range> = '[LT|LTEQ|GT|GTEQ] <constant>' <bounded range> = 'BTWN <constant> <constant>' <property name> = name of a numerical record property. <constant> = numerical constant that defines the range bounds.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.RangeFilter.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the filter.
member.returns: The string representation of the filter.
