member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig
member.summary: Class representing a dynamic refinement config for a dimension value. This will determine how refinements are computed under this dimension value. Use of a dynamic refinement config will suppress generation of a "More..." child dimension value. You can determine whether there are more refinements than the ones shown by looking at the "DGraph.More" property on the refinements' parent dimension value. Any of the settings in this class can be set explicitly or defaulted to use the corresponding dimension's settings in developer studio.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Default constructor where the dimValId sets the dimension value this dynamic refinement config is associated with.
member.param: Specifies which dimension value this dynamic refinement config is associated with.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the dynamic refinement config.
member.returns: The string representation of the dynamic refinement config.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.DimensionValueId
member.summary: Accessor which gets the Dimension value ID associated with this refinement config.
member.value: A long number, strictly greater than 0.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.DynamicRanking
member.summary: Accessor which gets and sets whether the dimension value has Dynamic Ranking enabled, disabled or defaults to the settings in Developer Studio.
member.value: A DynamicRankingState enum value: ENABLED, DISABLED or DEFAULT which uses the settings from Dev Studio.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.DynamicRankOrder
member.summary: Accessor which gets and sets whether the dimension value is sorted statically (ordered by refinement sort order), dynamically (ordered by refinement count). If set to use default then the dimension value will be sorted statically or dynamically depending on the dimension's setting in Developer Studio. This is only used if the dimension value has Dynamic Ranking enabled.
member.value: A DynamicRankOrderState enum value: STATIC, DYNAMIC or DEFAULT which uses the settings from Dev Studio.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.DynamicRefinementCount
member.summary: Accessor which gets and sets the maximum number of dimension values (refinements) to return to the user. This is only used if the dimension value has Dynamic Ranking enabled.
member.value: An OptionalInt specifying the maximum number of dimension values to return. An empty OptionalInt indicates to use the settings in Developer Studio. Defaults to an empty OptionalInt.

member.name: P:Endeca.Navigation.RefinementConfig.Exposed
member.summary: Accessor that gets and sets whether to expose the dimension value.
member.value: bool which is TRUE(dimension value is exposed) or FALSE (dimension value is not exposed). Defaults to TRUE.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.UrlENEQuery
member.summary: An object used for formulating queries to an Endeca MDEX Engine through the use of an input URL.
member.remarks:
A direct subclass of , allows an application to pass in an request URL's query string and autopopulate the query fields to automatically query the MDEX Engine objects specified in the URL. Like the superclass, a can express a request for a navigation, a record, a value search, and/or a value set search.
Navigation Query
Parameter Name Parameter Value Format ENEQuery Method
N Either 0 (zero) for a root navigation request, or one or more dimension value IDs.
Nao A number indicating the starting index of an aggregated record list.
Ne Either 0 indicating no refinement values are returned for any dimensions, or one or more dimension value IDs indicating which dimension navigation refinements will be exposed.
Nf
Sets a range filter with one of these formats:
key|LT+number
key|LTEQ+number
key|GT+number
key|GTEQ+number
key|BTWN+num1+num2
key|GCLT+lat,lon+number
key|GCGT+lat,lon+number
key|GCBTWN+lat,lon+num1+num2
Nk Specify none to request that no key properties be returned.
Nl Sets an analytics computation with the format: function|prop_key|rollup_key|prop_key|dimension_name|... where function is one of COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX, or CAVG.
No A number indicating the starting index of a record list.
Np Either 0 (no records are returned with each aggregated record), 1 (only a single representative record is returned with each aggregate record), or 2 (all records are returned with each aggregated record).
Nr The record filter for the navigation query.
Nrc
The dynamic refinement configs for the navigation query. Each dynamic refinement config is delimited by the pipe character and must have the id setting. Settings for a dynamic refinement config are: id: The dimension value id. Valid values are integers strictly greater than 0. exposed: Whether to expose the dimension value's refinement. Valid values are true which indicates exposed and false which indicates unexposed. Defaults to exposed. dynrank: Whether the dimension value has Dynamic Ranking enabled. Valid values are enabled disabled and defalut which uses the setting from Developer Studio. dyncount: The maximum number of dimension values to return. Valid values are integers >=0 or default which uses the setting from Developer Studio. dynorder: Dynamic Ranking sort order. Valid values are static, dynamic or default which uses the setting from Developer Studio.
Omission of a setting or specifying the value default results in using the setting in Developer Studio.
N=0&Nrc=id+134711+exposed+true+dynrank+enabled+dyncount+default+dynorder+dynamic|id+132830+dyncount+7
Nrs The structure expression for the navigation query.
Ns One or more sort keys (properties or dimensions) for a object's record list. Optionally, each sort key can specify a sort order of 0 (ascending sort, the default) or 1 (descending sort).
Ntk One or more search keys (properties or dimensions), each delimited by the pipe character.
Ntpc 1 (to turn on the computed alternative phrasings feature for a record search) or 0 (to turn it off). 0 is the default.
Ntpr 1 (to use a computed alternative phrasing for a record search) or 0 (to use the end user's original query). 0 is the default.
Ntt One or more terms for a record search. Each term is delimited by a plus sign, and each set of terms is delimited by the pipe character.
Ntx One or more sets of options for record search in the navigation query. These options include search mode, relevance ranking, and the snip and nosnip operators. Each set of options is delimited by the pipe character.
Nty 1 (to turn on the "Did You Mean" feature for a record search) or 0 (to turn it off). 0 is the default.
Nrk The search key for relevance ranking record search
Nrt One or more terms for relevance ranking record search. Each term is delimited by a plus sign.
Nrr The relevance ranking strategy to use with relevance ranking record search.
Nu A property or dimension to be used as a rollup key for aggregated records.
Record Query
Parameter Name Parameter Value Format ENEQuery Method
R One or more Endeca record IDs.
Aggregated Record Query
Parameter Name Parameter Value Format ENEQuery Method
A The record specification of the Endeca aggregated record.
Af One or more aggregated record navigation range filters. See the Nf parameter for the format.
An One or more dimension value IDs.
Ar The record filter for the aggregated record navigation query.
Ars The structure expression for the aggregated record query.
Au A property or dimension to be used as a rollup key for aggregated records.
Dimension Search Query
Parameter Name Parameter Value Format ENEQuery Method
D The dimension search query terms.
Df One or more dimension search range filters. See the Nf parameter for the format.
Di One or more IDs of dimensions to search against.
Dk 0 means means default dimension value ranking is used to order dimension search results, while 1 means relevance ranking is used.
Dn One or more dimension value IDs.
Do A number indicating the offset with which the dimension search will begin returning results per dimension.
Dp The number of dimension value matches to return per dimension.
Dr The record filter for the dimension search navigation query.
Drs The structure expression for the dimension search navigation query.
Dx The options for the dimension search operation.

member.name: T:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen
member.summary: A generic toolkit for manipulating and generating URL query strings.
member.remarks:
The intended use of was for the management of state and query parameters when dealing with objects.
takes either a query string in a constructor as the base query to work with or none which indicates that it begins with an empty base. The method called immediately after the constructor will return the original input URL or none if none was specified.
The remove params and add parameters are evaluated in order. That is removes placed after an add may delete the parameter you just added.
This toolkit attempts to preserve whatever input URL parameters are input to the system as long as they follow the structure of an & delimited, x-www-form-urlencoded parameter value pairs. In the case of multiple parameters with the same name, the multiple pairs will be preserved on output, however, a remove, or add with the same name will remove or overwrite the all of the keys with that name. An append on the other hand will preserve the previous prameter. Append adds parameters without knowledge of the previous.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.#ctor
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the constructor that takes an encoding instead. This version defaults to using the "windows-1252" encoding.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the constructor that takes an encoding instead. This version defaults to using the "windows-1252" encoding.
member.param: The base query string with which this class manipulates.
member.remarks: This URL is the base with which this manipulates. 's form is of URL query string. That is everything of a URL after the '?' mark and of the form where the query is made up of key value pairs delimited by '&' and each pair delimited by '=' and the keys and values are x-www-form-urlencoded.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor where the start URL will be the one specified in this constructor.
member.param: The base query string with which this class manipulates.
The encoding to use for the URL. Typically "windows-1252" or "UTF-8".
member.remarks: This URL is the base with which this manipulates. 's form is of URL query string. That is everything of a URL after the '?' mark and of the form where the query is made up of key value pairs delimited by '&' and each pair delimited by '=' and the keys and values are x-www-form-urlencoded.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.AppendParam(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Manipulates the resultant url by adding this key value pair.
member.param: Key name of the pair to be added.
Value to be added to the output url where the value is decoded.
member.remarks: This method will NOT overwrite any of the original parameters with the same key or any other parameter that got added by this same method previously with the same key. In addition, it is assumed that is decoded and will encode the value as x-www-form-urlencoded on output. Values that are null or equal to "" will be skipped so that this method can be blindly called without having to check if the value is present.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.AppendParams(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Bulk append of param pairs.
member.param: Collection of key value pairs.
member.remarks: Each member of the collection must be of the form (String) <key>=<value> where the value is in x-www-form-urlencoded form. The semantics of these are the same as individual calls to except that the values are encoded.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.AddParam(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Manipulates the resultant URL by adding this key value pair.
member.param: Key name of the pair to be added.
Value to be added to the output URL where the value is decoded.
member.remarks: This method will overwrite ANY of the original parameters with the same key and any other parameter that got added by this same method previously with the same key. In addition, it is assumed that is decoded and will encode the value as x-www-form-urlencoded on output. Values that are null or equal to "" will be skipped so that this method can be blindly called without having to check if the value is present.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.AddParams(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Bulk add of param pairs.
member.param: Collection of key value pairs.
member.remarks: Each member of the collection must be of the form (String) <key>=<value> where the value is in x-www-form-urlencoded form. The semantics of these are the same as individual calls to except that the values are encoded.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.RemoveParam(System.String)
member.summary: Removes any key value parameter from the to be outputted URL with the parameter name key.
member.param: Parameter pair(s) to remove with the specified parameter name.
member.remarks: This removes any parameter created preceeding this call either from the initial query string specified in the constructor or any parameter added from an call. In the case of multiple parameters with the same name, this remove will remove all pairs with the same name. As expected, calling remove on a with a empty constructor will not do anything as there will be no parameters to remove.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.RemoveParams(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Removes any key value parameter with the keys specified in the collection.
member.param: Collection of keys specifying parameter pairs to remove.
member.remarks: Same semantics as the call except that it is batch applied with . Each element of collection must be able to be casted as a and be non null.

member.name: M:Endeca.Navigation.UrlGen.ToString
member.summary: The output method on this class.
member.returns: The URL query string output of this class, where key value pairs are delimited by '&' and the pairs themselvs are delimited by '=' and the values are x-www-form-urlencoded.
member.remarks: This method will output a query string format of the input URL and subsequent add and remove calls. A call to this method does not invalidate the class but merely generates a snapshot output.

member.summary: Exception signalling the mismatch of two incompatible modules in the system while processing the query. Most often this exception is used to signal a mismatch between the and the Endeca MDEX Engine itself.
